intro: Valvaria, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in woodland or meadow environments. Valvaria has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, clustered blooms that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
